[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Model Manager (MM) defines requirements for managing model jobs within the Georgia Public Library PINES network.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: MM automates workflows for weather modeling, data synchronization, and job configurations.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: MM integrates with systems, databases, and APIs for model job management.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: MM provides a web-based GUI and command-line tools.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: MM supports deployment on servers, clusters, and processing nodes.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: MM interacts with job files, executables, and workflows.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: MM ensures secure data transfer using TLS and SFTP.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: MM optimizes resource management for high-volume simulations.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: MM adapts to centralized and distributed computing setups.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: MM supports vendor APIs and data exchange standards.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: MM provides job configuration, performance monitoring, and workflow integration.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: MM is designed for meteorologists, scientists, engineers, and administrators.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: MM relies on external systems for domain-specific processing.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: MM requires integration with existing IT infrastructure.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Model Job:  A process executing weather or climate modeling tasks.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall interface with job configuration files and execution libraries.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall integrate with secure APIs for data synchronization.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow users to set up and submit model jobs.
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall support submission of custom and predefined jobs (REQ-FUNC-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall retrieve and execute previously saved job configurations (REQ-FUNC-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive interface for job management.
[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-002: The system shall include accessibility features for diverse users.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process job submissions within 2 seconds.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall support up to 100 concurrent jobs.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store job configurations in a relational database.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall maintain data integrity during execution.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall use secure protocols for data transfer.
[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-002: The system shall ensure modularity for scalability.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with organizational IT security policies.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall log critical actions for auditing and send job notifications.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Unit, integration, and functional testing ensure system compliance.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User guides, configuration manuals, and training materials.
[SEC] 5. References: 4DWX OTM concept paper, Model Manager Wiki, and IT compliance standards.
